items.title: Teleurgesteld Everton vangt bot bij FA: Keane drie duels geschorst na harentrekken
items.summary: Everton is er niet in geslaagd de rode kaart van Michael Keane teruggedraaid te krijgen. De club maakte vrijdag via de officiÃ«le kanalen bekend dat het beroep tegen de schorsing van de verdediger is afgewezen door de Engelse voetbalbond. Daarmee blijft de schorsing van drie wedstrijden staan, tot grote teleurstelling van de club.

items.title: Pep: Man City beat 'many clubs' to Semenyo signing
items.summary: Pep Guardiola has revealed Manchester City beat off competition from "many clubs" to sign Antoine Semenyo from AFC Bournemouth.

items.title: Man City confirms Semenyo signing in $84m deal
items.summary: Manchester City have announced the signing of Antoine Semenyo from Bournemouth.

items.title: Neymar begins recovery after knee surgery
items.summary: Neymar has started his recovery process after undergoing minor surgery on his left knee on Dec. 22.

items.title: Fifa criticised for silence on World Cup tickets for disabled
items.summary: Fifa's failure to address concerns over tickets for disabled supporters at the World Cup is "unacceptable", a charity has said.

items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: ADO Den Haag, SC Cambuur en de rest
items.summary: De Keuken Kampioen Divisie wordt binnenkort hervat. Na meer dan de helft van het seizoen zijn de krachtsverhoudingen duidelijk. ADO Den Haag en SC Cambuur stevenen af op rechtstreekse promotie, veertien andere clubs hopen op play-off-deelname. Een tussenbalans in tien hoofdstukken.

items.title: Pepi hoeft geen gunsten te verwachten van Bosz: 'Wil kampioen worden'
items.summary: PSV-trainer Peter Bosz verleent geen gunsten richting Ricardo Pepi. Daarmee reageerde hij op vragen over de WK-kansen van de Amerikaanse spits, die in Eindhoven geen basisplaats heeft, maar wel graag met zijn land het eindtoernooi zou willen spelen. Als Pepi meer wil spelen, zal hij dat moet verdienen.

items.title: Bosz stellig over transferwensen PSV: 'Dan is er niets meer nodig'
items.summary: Gaat PSV deze maand op transfergebied nog iets doen? Trainer Peter Bosz kreeg daar op zijn persconferentie van vrijdag vragen over en was erg duidelijk.

items.title: New outfits and snow disruption: inside Macclesfield before jackpot FA Cup tie
items.summary: Phoenix club are lowest-ranked in third round and could have sold hundreds more tickets for visit of holders Crystal Palace In the corner of a small dressing room Macclesfieldâ€™s manager, John Rooney, and his assistant Francis Jeffers are locked in serious conversation. The pair scribble on tiny pieces of paper, planning one final training session before Saturdayâ€™s FA Cup third-round tie with the holders, Crystal Palace. The kit man, Ged Coyne, clutching his traditional plastic bag full of supermarket goodies, arrives and immediately the mood lightens, shoulders drop and smiles arrive. Next door music blasts out as the squad prepare for their morningâ€™s work. The surrounds are unfamiliar, snow necessitating a late venue switch to Manchester Metropolitan Universityâ€™s Platt Lane complex. Continue reading...

items.title: ASHES QUIZ: Test your knowledge from this winter's Test series
items.summary: England fans may wish to forget their team's 4-1 series defeat in Australia - but much do you remember about the Ashes just gone?

items.title: West Ham losing faith in Nuno and unhappy he embraced Forest players on pitch
items.summary: His demeanour after defeat by former club causes upset Nuno has two wins from 16 games since replacing Potter West Ham are losing faith in Nuno EspÃ­rito Santoâ€™s ability to save them from relegation and unhappy with their manager embracing Nottingham Forest players on the pitch after losing to his former side on Monday. Nuno, fired by Forest last September, finds his position under increasing threat after 10 games without a win. West Ham remain reluctant to make their second sacking of the season but are increasingly unimpressed with the Portugueseâ€™s tactics and did not like his demeanour after their latest defeat. Continue reading...

items.title: Semenyo completes circuitous rise from schoolboy rejection to Manchester City arrival
items.summary: Bournemouth will find it hard to replace a player at the peak of his powers, an attacker polished up perfectly for the elite Antoine Semenyoâ€™s rise is a reminder the big clubsâ€™ scouting systems are not infallible, that not all players will flower at the same time. Fulham, Arsenal, Crystal Palace, Millwall, Reading and Tottenham rejected the schoolboy Semenyo. At 15, he took a yearâ€™s absence from the game. A decade on, a circuitous route to the top alights at Manchester City, who beat a queue of big hitters to his signature. Bournemouthâ€™s ability to find talent the elite passed over continues to prove profitable. Pep Guardiolaâ€™s squad has another player who pairs physical power with a high skill level. It also adds a long-throw specialist to the armoury; City are towards the bottom of the metrics in that voguish category. Continue reading...

items.summary: 'Prince' Naseem Hamed has admitted he 'regrets' how his relationship deteriorated with iconic trainer Brendan Ingle.

items.title: Everton 'surprised' after Keane red card upheld
items.summary: Everton say they are "surprised and disappointed" after their appeal against Michael Keane's red card against Wolves is rejected.

items.summary: Luke Littler has earned a historic payday after agreeing a record Â£20m deal with his dart supplier.

items.title: Atherton: Ashes defeat will 'haunt England for years'
items.summary: Michael Atherton fears England will be "haunted" by their latest Ashes failure for years to come.
